title: Pokemon Legends: Z-A Is Adding Hoenn Starter Mega Stones As Ranked Rewards
description:
The Pokemon Company has revealed the next slate of Ranked Battle rewards coming to Pokemon Legends: Z-A. Players will have a chance to earn Mega Stones for the Hoenn starter Pokemon--Sceptile, Swampert, and Blaziken--during the next few seasons of the game's online multiplayer mode.
Like other special Mega Stones, these elusive items are not otherwise obtainable in the game, so you'll need to participate in Ranked Battles if you want to snag them. Sceptilite will be available during Season 5; Swampertite will be distributed during Season 6; and Blazikenite can be earned during Season 7.
As before, you'll need to hit a certain rank before the season ends to earn the Mega Stones.

title: The Push to Impeach Pete Hegseth Is On
description: Chris...
fullText:
Democratic Representative Shri Thanedar has filed articles of impeachment against the secretary of defense over the murderous attacks on boats in the Caribbean.

As Secretary of Defense Pete Hegseth becomes more deeply mired in the scandal surrounding the military strikes against alleged drug-trafficking boats in the Caribbean, familiar refrains of Beltway discourse have lurched into gear. Democrats in Congress, for instance, are issuing calls for greater ‚Äútransparency‚Äù and official ‚Äúaccountability‚Äù and vowing to widen the probes into the murderous attacks.

There is certainly much to investigate about Hegseth, who appears to have issued a second order to kill two stranded survivors in the first strike, and then proceeded to lie about doing so. Yet, amid the well-worn rounds of congressional inquiries and special investigations, Justice Department task forces, military probes, and international court proceedings, a cabinet criminal‚Äôs forcible removal from office is an all-but-guaranteed non-result. That‚Äôs why it‚Äôs so maddening that Democratic lawmakers have largely balked at invoking the most effective tool to secure such accountability‚Äîa motion to impeach Hegseth.

It‚Äôs hard to think of a case where impeachment would be a more appropriate remedy. After all, if murder doesn‚Äôt qualify as a ‚Äúhigh crime and misdemeanor,‚Äù what does? And an impeachment inquiry, closely targeted on documenting criminal charges, would be an encouraging first step in holding Hegseth accountable for his conduct in an actually meaningful way.

Of course, an allied piece of conventional Beltway wisdom is that impeachments are inherently political‚Äîand therefore politically risky. And few Beltway operators are more conventional than the Democrats‚Äô terminally risk-averse House leader, Hakeem Jeffries. So it wasn‚Äôt shocking when Jeffries made a point of ruling out an official impeachment inquiry not long after news of Hegseth‚Äôs role in the second strike first broke. Jeffries claimed that planned investigations by the House and Senate Armed Services Committees should produce ‚Äúa meaningful investigation which we can hope would be bipartisan‚Äù‚Äîwhile also claiming that House Republican leaders were far too partisan to permit any impeachment articles to make it onto the legislative calendar.

Leaving aside the plain self-contradictory nature of Jeffries‚Äôs stand, the mechanism of impeachment isn‚Äôt actually as cumbersome as he makes it out to be. Under Rule IX of the House, any member can bring a motion to impeach a member of the executive branch under a privileged vote‚Äîmeaning that House leaders in either major party don‚Äôt need to approve it in advance. Once an impeachment resolution is introduced under Rule IX, the House has a two-day window to vote on it, in a straight up-or-down balloting‚Äîor else to endorse another resolution to dismiss the impeachment one.

This is precisely the course of action that Michigan Democratic Representative Shri Thanedar is now pursuing against Hegseth. On Tuesday, Thanedar announced that he had filed articles of impeachment against Hegseth.

Just introduced House Resolution 935, Impeaching Peter B. Hegseth, Sec. of Defense for high crimes and misdemeanors.

Thanedar‚Äôs motion cites both the second strike carried out on September 2 and the recent damning Pentagon investigation into Hegseth‚Äôs unauthorized sharing of details of a bombing raid in Yemen on an unsecure Signal group chat. ‚ÄúHere‚Äôs a secretary of defense who is managing a trillion-dollar budget, sending people into harm‚Äôs way, and he needs to be acting responsibly,‚Äù Thanedar said in an interview with The Nation. ‚ÄúThe fact that he gives out war plans on a Signal chat puts our service members in grave danger.‚Äù

As for the Caribbean strike, Thanedar added, ‚ÄúReally, this is murder; it has nothing to do with drugs and protecting the United States‚Äù‚Äînoting as well that President Donald Trump has recently pardoned former Honduran president Juan Orlando Hernandez, who was convicted of trafficking some 450 tons of cocaine into the United States.

The first article in Thanedar‚Äôs resolution charges Hegseth with ‚Äúmurder and conspiracy to murder,‚Äù bypassing the more vague and euphemistic suggestion in most mainstream press reports that he may be guilty of ‚Äúwar crimes.‚Äù (An ancillary problem with this phrasing is that there is no declared war, or even a similarly euphemized ‚Äúpolice action‚Äù that governs the US military‚Äôs rules of engagement in jury-rigged, barely rationalized attacks that are themselves illegal.) The article specifies that, in the September 2 attack, ‚Äúin compliance with the order of Peter B. Hegseth, the Armed Forces carried out a second strike with the express, willful, and deliberate purpose of killing the shipwrecked survivors of the first strike,‚Äù citing provisions in the Defense Department‚Äôs Law of War Manual that proscribe actions that deprive survivors of quarter after attack‚Äîlet alone actions that kill them outright after an initial attack. The second article calls for Hegseth to be impeached and removed from office for circulating the plans for the Yemen strike on the Signal group chat last spring.

Given that leaders in both parties want nothing to do with it, Thanedar‚Äôs resolution might not ultimately travel too far. But there‚Äôs a great deal to be said for simply initiating a serious discussion of Hegseth‚Äôs impeachment on the Hill. To begin with, an impeachment resolution represents a come-to-Jesus moment for all members of Congress to take a clear stand on Hegseth‚Äôs actions. For Democrats in particular, the continued invocation of the Trump White House‚Äôs criminal trespasses and threats to democratic self-rule start to ring hollow in the absence of clear measures to attach tangible consequences to the perpetrators. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs what makes them look weak,‚Äù said a consultant familiar with the Thanedar resolutions, who requested anonymity to speak candidly. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve heard it before‚Äî it‚Äôs a bit of a DC elite bubble thing to say, ‚ÄòOh, the last impeachments backfired or failed.‚Äô But it‚Äôs not true‚Äîthe Democrats didn‚Äôt really pay any price at the ballot box‚Äù after their successive bids to impeach Trump in 2019 and 2021. ‚ÄúI think you can‚Äôt go out there and say, ‚ÄòThey‚Äôre criminals and [Trump‚Äôs] trying to be a dictator,‚Äô which is true and important, without something to back it up. And it‚Äôs not like they‚Äôd be taking a run at this at a time when he‚Äôs at an even split in the polls; he‚Äôs got a 20 percent disapproval gap.‚Äù

That‚Äôs a key reason that, even before they were formally introduced, Thanedar‚Äôs articles of impeachment got resounding endorsements from members of the Democratic Party‚Äôs activist base. ‚ÄúPete Hegseth is an incredibly unqualified Christian nationalist lackey and alleged abuser who never should have been nominated in the first place,‚Äù said Hunter Dunn, a spokesperson for the 50501 movement, which has been instrumental in organizing the successful wave of No Kings protests across the country. ‚ÄúHis support of Russia‚Äôs war crimes, the Genocide in Gaza, his role in Signalgate, his attempts to censor press, and his overall incompetence would each be reason enough for his removal. After he murdered multiple sailors in the Caribbean, the only place he belongs is in a jail cell. As such, we‚Äôre working on a number of different avenues to push towards his ousting, including having our members contact congressional representatives and lobby for impeachment, leveraging our social media platforms to build public support for an investigation into Hegseth and his removal, and targeted demonstrations.‚Äù Thanedar, who had earlier sought to initiate an Article IX impeachment measure against Trump until Democratic leaders prevailed on him to withdraw it, is now looking for a better reception from the party‚Äôs rank-and-file members, together with some possible recruits from the chamber‚Äôs increasingly fractious GOP majority. ‚ÄúWhat we saw from the Epstein files vote was that Republicans are now willing to question this president, and are willing to go against him on the right issue.‚Äù And if nothing else, he added, a Hegseth impeachment vote should supply a record to keep organizing around. ‚ÄúThe question is not ‚ÄòWhat is the politics?‚Äô or ‚ÄòWhat do the polls say?‚Äô It‚Äôs more about, ‚ÄúDoes this amount to a crime?‚Äô If it does, then we need to do what is right‚Ä¶. This puts members of Congress on notice to take a stand. That‚Äôs what we‚Äôre elected to do.‚Äù
